thread.title: Today in history: Record: Maidens beat Germany to bronze in World Cup
thread.title_full: Today in history: Record: Maidens beat Germany to bronze in World Cup

title: Today in history: Record: Maidens beat Germany to bronze in World Cup
text:
13:40 CET Today in history: Record: Maidens beat Germany to bronze in World Cup - www.allsports.com.gh 
On 13 October, 2012, Ghana beat Germany 1-0 to finish third at FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup staged in Azerbaijan 2012 despite finishing the game numerically disadvantaged. 
A first half strike by captain Priscilla Okyere in the 38th minute handed the Black Maidens bronze on Saturday in Baku giving Ghana their best-ever finish at a FIFA women's competition. 
Before the winner, the Black Maidens, for the second consecutive time at the tournament saw red when after the half-hour, Fatima Alhassan picked up her second yellow card within four minutes. 
Despite Ghana, having a player sent off, they held on for a greater part of the game to deny their opponents any sight of goal. 
The meeting was the second between both sides after the Germans edged Ghana 2-1 in their opening Group D fixture. 
Black Maidens, following that victory became the first Africans to win a medal in the FIFA u-17 World Cup. 
For more sports news visit allSports.com.gh
